Downloading and Installing the Java Development Kit

In order to develop (compile and run) Java programs, you need to install a Java Development Kit. This free kit is available from:

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html

When your installation is complete, you should modify the PATH environment variable to include the directories containing the javac.exe and java.exe executables.

You can develop Java programs using Textpad and a command line window, like I am doing in class. If you prefer to do development using an IDE (Integrated Development Environement) like IDLE, use the excellent Eclipse IDE.

Java Documentation Online

An extensive set of Java tutorials are available at http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/

All Java class libraries are documented with the documentation available online: JavaAPI.

In general the Javadoc page for any class contains information about:

  • Where this class falls in the class hierarchy. What classes are its parents and what classes are its decendents.
  • A summary and some examples of using the class.
  • A summary listing of instance variables
  • A summary listing of Constructor
  • A summary listing of Methods
  • Detailed documentation on constructors and methods.

Typically the Javadoc pages are constructed from the source code where the class is implemented. This encourages Java programmers to do a good job of documenting their code, while providing a user friendly way to read the documentation without looking at the code directly.
